I never had the urge to start this game... but then one day.. I felt like doing some evil.
So, I bought this KILLER-simulator and see what it is all about...

I kinda went for survivor instead... (Weird, Ikr) and I loved the games where we worked together to escape this evil killer who tries to bully us into hell.
Tried killer games after that and I mostly felt sorry for my last survivor standing.. so I gave him/her a pass to heaven instead.

- If you're playing this simulator with friends to survive, it's a blast.
- If you're playing this simulator alone to survive, it's a mixed bag. It all depends who your random teammates are.
- There are tons of survivors (2021) and they all have their unique look and perks (which can be learned by other survivors later on too)

If you're playing this simulator to kill... well, be prepared to either annihilate your enemies or be left alone to cry in the corner.
- Killers are fun in their own unique way, and it drastically changes the game-play.

Be sure to try both sides (survivor and killer) to understand both views.
Pick a few mains and get used to their abilities and perks.

The community is rather toxic, sadly. I mean, you get flamed for using certain perks, camping or tunneling when it's just the current situation that's important. I try to be as polite and positive, but sometimes these trolls are really annoying. Don't get me wrong, there are some really nice people playing this game too, and when you meet some... perhaps add them to your friend list for future adventures in the realm of the entity (the creature who hires them evil killers to destroy us all).

The game is being updates monthly and it's a blast to explore the new stuff.

So go out there, YOU, and try to errr... KILL or SURVIVE... err YOU!!

I've spend around 3k~4k hours on this game, and I completely lost my faith on it because of the issues below:
1. The balance is horrendous, so horrible that making the game feels super unplayable.
2. The devs ignored the feedbacks of their audiences, including their Fog Whisperers. 
3. So many bugs and exploits in the game, and BHVR didn't even fix all of them, and it gets worse and worse every last update.
4. BHVR continuously making changes that makes no sense and not even necessary, but choose to ignore the biggest issues of the game.
5. The game has plenty of hackers/cheaters/exploiters now.
6. Pinhead is NFT product.

Es un buen juego para darle con amigos, 4 supervivientes contra 1 asesino.
Los desarrolladores están continuamente añadiendo contenido nuevo, balanceando personajes, corrigiendo bugs, etc.
Tiene una comunidad muy buena y amplia detrás.

Como consejos, no os frustréis al principio, tiene una pequeña curva de aprendizaje. Sin saber, probablemente moriréis al poco de encontraros con el asesino, pero id aprendiendo poco a poco y se volverá muy divertido.

Edit: Años después sigo jugando y lo sigo recomendando.

where do i start... seriously

i honestly cant really think of many good reasons to play this game right now apart from if you wanna play as your favourite killer from a movie or something, even then you wont enjoy it.
The last few patches of this game have honestly been terrible, the game is completely unbalanced and this is coming from a 75 / 25 survivor main. The recent update added a new mechanic into the game known as boon totems where survivors were basically able to add their own hex's into the match so you could say, which gives significant buffs to everyone in that area, imo the concept is pretty cool BUT its really not healthy as of how this game stands right now. 

I honestly respect all the people that actually want to queue the killer role because my god its so not fun lately. the fact its so much harder to control the game as of recent patches being heavily survivor based and now the addition of survivors having hex totems its like bruh... who actually wants to play a game which makes you stressed 24/7? i don't get it. The decrease in the amount of people searching as killer also means longer survivor queue times which then also makes it unfun for survivors as it takes forever to get into games i just cant seem to enjoy the game right now, even tho i really try to. This is also coming from someone who plays on the competitive scene with 2,000 hours so i do have some knowledge on the game.

Also one more thing which i want to mention thats been happening nearly once every 4 games is the amount of server dc's that happen before the match even loads, i seem to be spending more time on the loading screen rather than actually playing the game, its really only been happening frequently since the new update which came out yesterday so im willing to cut it some negativity as its recently new but still its the fact that if the lobby dc's when you are connecting it takes roughly 6-7 mins before it actually pulls you into the end game screen which is too long in my opinion and its pretty boring.

Don't get me wrong i would love to leave a positive review on this game as i do really enjoy it but as the game currently stands i struggle to do so, also doesn't help when most of the survivor sided community are entitled 10 year old's
